dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN on a MOVING WIDE SHOT of a mountain range with the distant lights of the San Fernando Valley behind it. BEGIN CREDITS as a NAVY JET drops down into the picture. PUSH IN on the jet's exhaust flame. Have the words "THE BLAST" come out of the flame. Then there is a SLIGHT EXPLOSION and the flame intensifies. The words "FROM THE PAST" jump out of the exhaust as the jet momentarily shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PILOT feels the jet shake. But he looks at his indicators and everything appears to be normal. He relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We begin with a WIDER REAR SHOT of the jet and allow the plane to move away. Then SUPER: "LOS ANGELES, 1962" before continuing the main titles. A popular recording from that period has been playing throughout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start on a CU of the HAM RADIO ANTENNA, WIND GAUGE and THERMOMETER attached to the roof of Calvin's shop. (We can hear military air traffic chatter on Calvin's Hallicrafter radio.) Then move down to the window where we see CALVIN Webber tinkering with a gadget at his work bench. Calvin's very pregnant wife HELEN appears. The music becomes source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Pete's sake, Calvin!  We've got guests!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, honey!  I just got to fooling with this darn rheostat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, put it down and come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet, hon! They exit the workshop for the house.  Calvin has left the ham radio on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower, Wolf One is five miles from the overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf One, Tower. Report the numbers. You're number one for the overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG PILOT looks down at the flashing red light on his control panel. He speaks into the oxygen mask that hangs loosely from his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower. Wolf One. I've got a problem here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say your problem, Wolf One. Are you declaring an emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand by. One.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVE, BETTY, BOB, and RUTH (30's) pass around the buffet table. Another period song is playing on the phonograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember: don't mention the communists!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin's a great guy, but he's a little, you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nutty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his wife like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know, housewife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Likes to cook. Pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normal, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn't go that far. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen! Helen has entered from the kitchen with more food. She favors June Allison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Betty!  Dave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any day now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my sister and her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi! Welcome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is using a cocktail shaker to very carefully make Rob Roys for the crowd at the bar. It's like watching a chemist at work. Calvin's a pipe-smoker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So anyhow this duck says to the clerk, "I'd like to buy this lip balm."  And the clerk says, "Will that be cash or a check?"  And the duck says, "Just put it on my bill!" Polite laughter follows, but the guy out of Calvin's sight-line rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE AND BOB
dialogues.text: with drinks. Helen is in the b.g., rushing around, over- serving everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the golden-boy professor at Cal Tech.  But then he starts inventing things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me.  Some kind of special synthetic rubber.  And some kind of automated machine.  Anyhow, suddenly he gets rich.  I mean rich!  And quits teaching.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: as his guests sample their Rob Roys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what the doctor ordered! Calvin gives the man his patented thumbs-up sign.

dialogues.speaker: BETTY AND RUTH
dialogues.text: over by the patio doors. We can see Calvin's shop through the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all his money they could have moved to Beverly Hills, but they decided to stay in the Valley.  Calvin spends all his time tinkering out there in his workshop.  If you ask me it's all very strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chiming in)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dug a huge hole out there for a swimming pool. Then he decided he didn't want it and filled the thing in. And what's that big, high fence for? The women look at Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: CALVIN
dialogues.text: with guests (one is called Harold) at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There currently exists a type of neon light that lasts five years.  But you won't see it on the market. Same is true of batteries. I could take your simple yacht battery and rig it to last a decade, easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what the heck kind of a marketing system can't get great new products like that out to the public?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A veeeery good one, Harold. Free market capitalism may not be a perfect order, but it's the best we've got, or will ever have.  And why?  Three reasons! Poor Harold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the guests are women, gabbing and helping Helen out as she removes a pot roast from the oven and busily jumps around the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, Helen?  What does Calvin think about this trouble down in Cuba?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please don't bring that up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A late guest named RON hurries up the walkway and into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is with another guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say my baseball card collection is as complete as any one I've ever seen. Ron pushes his way through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin!  Hey, Calvin! (pointing over his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kennedy's going toe-to-toe with Khrushchev on the television! Calvin immediately heads for the family room. Others follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is huddled around the JFK TV press conference. There seems to be a lot of smokers. Helen appears shortly, wearing a hot pad mitten on each hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this sudden, clandestine decision to station strategic weapons for the first time outside of Soviet soil, is a deliberately provocative and unjustified change in the status quo which cannot be accepted by this country. Calvin cuts a knowing look at Helen who dutifully returns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane swoops over the Valley and we see the spectacular lights of L.A. sprawl.  There is a TRAIL OF SPARKS coming from the jet's engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is shaking terribly and the pilot is having a very hard time controlling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolf One -- say intentions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got secondaries of an engine fire and I'll need to find a clear area to eject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Wolf One. Can you make it to the ocean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trembling plane circles to the west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return to TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we will not prematurely or unnecessarily risk the cost of worldwide nuclear war, in which even the fruits of victory would be ashes in our mouth.  But neither will we shrink from the risk at any time it must be faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Helen's embarrassment, Calvin is ushering  all the guests to the front door. Helen is passing out hats and purses. She and Calvin speak simultaneously - somewhere in the middle we cut outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry everyone, but given this extraordinary turn of events, I think it's prudent that we cut the evening short. I'm sure this Cuban thing will resolve itself, but in the meantime...I'd suggest taking a prayerful watch-and-wait stance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do this again! Maybe next week. Here's your hat. Could I wrap something up for you? Did you have a coat? Helen can barely get a "good night" out before Calvin shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE AND BOB
dialogues.text: Following their wives out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto to Bob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I tell ya?! Bob whistles softly. Calvin's a nut all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin turns to Helen, a grave expression on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (misinterpreting, holding her stomach)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time? Oh, no Calvin. It's not time yet. I still have-- He points down. HELEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that time! You know Calvin, I'm not sure I'm really ready for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary, I think we're the only ones who are. He leads her out of shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin I'm sure everything's going to be all right. I just know it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin and Helen leave the house; cross the patio; and hurry to the shop. Back in the house, the record player has been left on:  "How Much Is That Doggie In The Window...?"  Helen is carrying the pot roast which is wrapped in foil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm certainly not going to let the pot roast go to waste. Could you just put that seat cover back on that lawn chair? He does. HELEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't we at least turn off the phonograph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shuts off automatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you rig it to do that? You're so clever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They all do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never know anymore. The SOUND OF THE TRAINER JET makes a low pass over Calvin's house.  Calvin sticks his head out the door and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet that's a fighter jet on his way to Key West!  Good luck, amigo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. The place is full of tools and gadgets-- mostly construction equipment. The ham radio is still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An emergency has been declared. I repeat, an emergency has been declared. Calvin and Helen speak over the Tower who is telling other aircraft in the vicinity to clear the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Calvin unplugs the radio and quickly wraps the cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can listen to the rest downstairs! He pushes aside a table that is hiding a hatch in the floor and unlocks it by turning the hatch's wheel.  Then he opens the hatch and reaches inside to turn on a light. Red submarine light shines up from below.  All the while he and Helen are chatting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin, I wish you would have at least let me do the dishes. It's not going to be that easy getting all that dried- on food off my nice plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope those plates aren't radioactive by tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cheese is particularly troublesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worse than your Kraft Holiday dip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, much worse. But not as bad as that Mexican Jumping Bean dip. You remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. Okay.  Give me the roast and watch your step.  I'll come back for the radio. She steps into the hatch and onto a ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The young pilot is bouncing around the now smokey cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tower, say again!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SAR HELO is airborne with you in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm marking the 180 radial for five and ejecting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger, Wolf One. The pilot rights the plane; points the joy stick; and reaches for the ejection handles between his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot ejects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the pilot's POV (were there a pilot.)  We see the coastline and we notice that the plane is making a... U- turn, away from the water and back towards the Valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Streaking back to the Valley with a dramatic tail of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices that his plane is headed directly at him.  It misses him by a matter of yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking the liberty of a CUTAWAY SECTION, we follow them down the ladder which is inside a corrugated metal tube. On either side of the tube we see layers of dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will we have to stay down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. For this thing to blow over, it could take days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rather safe than sorry. That's my motto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, what if I go into labor? That could happen any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read up on it. I'll deliver the baby myself if I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me Calvin Webber, when this baby comes, you're going to be out in the waiting room smoking yourself to death with all the other fathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we've got that straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It COMPLETES ITS TURN and STREAKS SKYWARD at a 90 degree angle to the ground... until it SPUTTERS and the ENGINES STOP.  Then, after a Road Runner-like beat or two, it begins to FALL DIRECTLY BACK TO EARTH, tail first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Webbers step off a metal ladder and face a vault-like chrome hatchway.  Calvin opens the six-inch thick door by pushing another switch on his small box. Helen takes the roast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With only the sound of wind, the jet continues to fall as the lights of the Valley rush up to meet it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step into a darkened room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with arms spread)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home sweet home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you maybe. Calvin flicks a wall switch and we HEAR A SERIES OF LIGHTS COMING ON.  The echoes of the sounds suggest a large, cavernous space.  All we can see is the cinder block wall behind them and the hatch door, which Calvin begins to shut by putting his body into it. Just then there is a TREMENDOUS DOUBLE EXPLOSION FROM ABOVE which knocks them to the floor. (Note: Helen hangs on to the roast, trying her best not to drop it.) The

dialogues.speaker: LADDER, CORRUGATED TUBE, ROOF, AND LOTS OR DIRT AND ROCK
dialogues.text: BEGIN TO CRASH DOWN INTO THE ANTEROOM. Calvin struggles to his feet and gets the vault door shut just in the nick of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?! Hanging on to the roast she nods vigorously, trying to be brave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I think so. Calvin hurries to a bright RED METAL BOX on the wall. Next to the box is a LARGE THERMOMETER OR GAUGE that's labeled "Radiation Count."  There are OTHER GAUGES that are dropping to zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!  It's happened!  Look at that heat!!  All my surface indicators are knocked out!  Oh, my Lord...it's actually happened!!

dialogues.speaker: INTER CUT
dialogues.text: The box has a dial on it, next to which is a large lever. A foreboding sign reads  HATCHWAY TIME LOCKS, USE EXTREME CAUTION.  Calvin pulls the lever.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The chrome and steel EXIT HATCHWAY AUTOMATICALLY LOCKS with great noise, precision and...finality. There is the SOUND OF A REAR DOOR doing the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The locks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep us from trying to leave. After an atomic blast there's a radiation half-life that lasts thirty five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty -five years!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then after that it's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's safe. She continues to stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To go up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To go up. She continues to stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey. Don't you worry. We're going to be just fine. Helen bursts into tears.

dialogues.speaker: EXT WEBBER PATIO
dialogues.text: Two police detectives, LEVY and ATKINSON, exit the house. Uniformed workers carefully carry small pieces of the jet from the crash site. The detectives lead us to what's left of Calvin's shop. It's mostly a charred crater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to Caltech, this Webber guy was a bonafide genius and a borderline nutcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he and Mrs. Nutcase must have been out here when the plane hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we get a postcard or somethin', that's my guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about relatives?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All back East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbors over there said the guy spent day and night out here. She'd bring him sandwiches and hot Dr. Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drank it hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen awakes alone and still dressed. She sits up and trys the phone on the night table. It is dead. She hangs up and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is making sandwiches from the pot roast. Two empty Doctor Pepper bottles sit next to the stove where Calvin is heating the soda. He sees Helen enter the livingroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey! Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be strong, sweetheart. If not for ourselves, for the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All our friends... He enters with her sandwich and a cup of Dr. Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnt to a crisp. (indicating sandwiches)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've given you the most well-done cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot Dr. Pepper! Your favorite!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Calvin, you're favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? She walks out onto the patio. She rubs her arms as if cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bit chilly? Shouldn't be. Temperature's a nice 73 degrees. He follows her out to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I've just got the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you?! This is just like home! A reverse angle shows for the first time the rest of the fallout shelter -- which looks very different from "home". Perhaps she starts to cry again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No! Calvin, this is different! Believe me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like a tranquilizer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have tranquilizers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you! I've got everything! Helen groans in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, oh. Now it's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey?

dialogues.speaker: THE SHELTER
dialogues.text: We can only hear Adam's entrance into the world. There is Helen's pain, followed by Adam's cry, followed by Calvin's rejoicing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first child to be born on earth after the annihilation!!

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Start on the record player in the living room. The country and western classic "Hey, Good Looking" is spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin walks through checking things over; pleased by what he sees.  He exits. ("Hey Good Looking" continues.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin checks the switch he uses to control the lights. Then he checks out all the tiny fish swimming in the six feet by six feet tank.  When he hears a baby's cry he hurries away.(Music continues)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin enters and smiles with great affection at his family:  Helen and a NEWBORN SON cradled next to her in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Calvin.  Babies cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've noticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall we call him? Calvin shrugs. HELEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking...in light of the situation...that we should call him Adam.  That's not sacrilegious is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I think it's just right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was wondering...if...if I could have a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I...you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Whatever you want, Helen! She points upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a bedroom ceiling. They both look up. Then he tells her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got it! Calvin happily gives her his patented thumbs-up sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arriving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We looked all over for you. What are you doing back here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I was just examining this rear hatchway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reason. (then, off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's pretty clear that the front entrance caved in when the bomb went off. So, you know, when the time is up, we'll have to return to the surface using, you know, this back entrance.  Which is very nice because it has the service elevator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice. Unless it caved in, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Well... yes. A sober beat, then: CALVIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me? Helen nods vigorously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She sets Adam (one year old) down on his wobbly little legs, steadying him at the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Daddy, Adam. Go to Daddy. And Adam takes his first step. And then another! And another! It's a joyous event.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN THOROUGHFARES WENT COMMERCIAL.
dialogues.text: A SIGN tells us that this is the future site of MOM'S

dialogues.speaker: MALT SHOP."
dialogues.text: Some WORKMEN with shovels have discovered the REAR SHELTER DOORS where they have been digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Boss! The construction BOSS comes over for a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn if I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet it's some kinda septic tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen a septic tank that looked like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't fool with it. If it is a septic tank, I sure as hell don't want to open it. We'll just lay the foundation over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Realtor steps out with A COUPLE looking to buy the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and since it's almost certain that the Webbers were killed, the bank is selling the house and that back parcel over there that's been re-zoned commercial. It's right there on the avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that where the plane crashed? She points out to a LEVEL LAWN where the shop used to be. We can see the Malt Shop construction crew beyond that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place gives me the willies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know what you mean. But the price is right.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS, DAY
dialogues.text: The guy driving the heavy front loader lets the bucket slam to the ground hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin vaguely hears the noise made by the front loader.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Calvin smokes his pipe and enjoys a Manhattan cocktail as Adam (three and a half) sits in his lap reading the title page from Alice in Wonderland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al ice in won der lan. Calvin smiles pridefully over at Helen who works intensely on the couch making a coffee-can Santa from instructions in the The Redbook Crafts Collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for a three and a half year old! I'd like to see the public school system match that! I don't care how terrific it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's very bright, dear. Much like his father. But you know, Calvin, maybe he's a little...young for school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. People have no idea what the human mind is capable of. Look at us! Helen ponders that statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the book's art work)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Daddy. Alice went down a hole, just like us. Calvin smiles and messes up Adam's hair. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I ever get to go up on top?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you certainly will. And you'll find a nice girl and rebuild America. Just the way it used to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Calvin, I'm not sure we should be making promises that perhaps can't be kept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe there will be other survivors. In fact, I'm guessing there's life on the surface, even now. It's not life worth living perhaps, but believe me, something's moving around up there. And I don't just mean the cockroaches. They both look nervously up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARS PASS BY on the busy avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLEAN CUT SURFER KIDS are being served their favorite ice cream and malt treats by MOM herself and a young SODA JERK. Appropriate music comes from the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need two more banana- splits and a cherry coke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet, Mom! Coming up! Two YOUNG MEN IN BEATLE HAIRCUTS enter. Everyone looks at them in amazement. (Perhaps there is also a record change here.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin is building and furnishing a classroom from materials available to him. He has had the forethought to bring down the books needed for his child's education. Little Adam is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing in the world is more fun than learning new things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family watches the same "Honeymooner" clip they watched before. Calvin still finds it funny. Helen wonders about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is pouring cooking sherry into an empty Listerine bottle.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Other buildings have been constructed around the malt shop. Foot and car traffic are heavier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clean-cut kids have been replaced by FLOWER CHILDREN. Mom hasn't put a lot back into the decor, but she has made concessions to the fashions of the time. The jukebox plays something appropriate. Mom and the Jerk are five years older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell the boys from the girls anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stoned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah. It's like hard. Mom gives the Jerk a suspicious look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin (40) is giving Adam (8) a boxing lesson. They work from a "How To" book and use gloves made from living room pillows. Adam's pretty good. Helen appears and watches with pride. Then she interupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys! Excuse me, but I believe it's my turn. (holding out her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam? He goes to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hydroponic garden area is empty. A Perry Como song begins and Adam and Helen enter waltzing. Adam has changed shirts and combed his hair. Somewhere, Calvin is watching with pride. After a while Calvin cuts in. He and Helen dance beautifully. Then they kiss. Somewhere, Adam is watching with pride.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: The place continues its decline. Acid rock plays loudly. Mom and the Jerk serve the smallish crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss those nice flower-power kids. How 'bout you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after studying her for some time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...uh... The acid rock song ends and an early, bad disco hit comes on the jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell kind of music is that?! The Jerk puts his hands to his ears, he so hates the new music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. I'm like not sure I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room looks like Ricky Nelson's class.  There are twin pictures of Ike and JFK on the wall.  Adam is eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what money looks like.  It comes like this, in coin, or like this in paper.  Or you can have an "investment."  These are stock "certificates" that we bought in your name.  Of course, they're worthless now, but at one time they were quite valuable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're pretty.  Can I have them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Now, let's move on to our French exam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latin exam, Dad.  It's Tuesday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right!  It's Tuesday already! By gosh, time flies, doesn't it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tempus fugit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: En arte voluptus. Que les bons temps roulГ€!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gerade aus dann links!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorgen sie bitte dafur das die gepack sorgfaltic behandeldt warren!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haben sie etuas nettes in leder?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (marveling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you have a wonderful sense of humor, son!  I must say, the acorn doesn't fall very far from the tree. By the way, it's time I gave you something. Come with me. Adam follows his dad out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass Helen who is absentmindedly poking at the puck with a stick. She's not having a very good day. She wears her hair dryer but it's not plugged in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin hands Adam a cigar box. Adam opens it to see Calvin's remarkable baseball card collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my entire baseball collection. It's yours now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's baseball?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a game, son. I can explain it pretty easily. There's a pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a painting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, son. A pitcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like one of Mom's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, no. There's a man who throws the ball -- to a man who has a bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nocturnal flying mammal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sit down. They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start close on flashing roller skates. Then cut wider to show Adam roller skating. He passes Helen who has fallen asleep knitting in one of the lawn chairs. Then Adam passes Calvin who is on a ladder soldering a leaking ceiling pipe.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: TWO PUNKS with spiked green hair enter to the strains of "My Sharona."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom watches the punks enter. Then crosses to the Soda Jerk who now has a tattoo on his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm selling this place.  I want out of this hell hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I, like...oh, wow...like,uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buy it from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!  Yeah, that's it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give it to ya, no money down. The neighborhood has gone to hell anyway. She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Helen has prepared a birthday cake. Having no birthday candles, she's used three votive candles. We can hear Calvin and Adam talking in the dining room. (She and Calvin are now in their 60's.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no! The runner on second goes to third! He's out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's forced out at third! It's a force!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why go there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he must!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming! Calvin enters. CALVIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the presents and do the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Calvin leaves while Helen lights the candles. The whole shelter goes dark. Calvin returns with two presents wrapped in whatever is available.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen and Calvin enter singing Happy Birthday. We see the ADULT ADAM for the first time in silhouette. His handsome face is revealed to us when the cake is placed before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mom! Thanks, Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow out the candles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a wish! He does both. His parents clap. Helen takes one of the presents from Calvin and gives it to Adam. He unwraps it. It's a green coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! A jacket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom made that all by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding. (aside, to Calvin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else would have done it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I made these! He gives Adam the second present. Adam tears off the paper to find a pair of roller-skates that Calvin has redesigned. The new skates look kind of like rollerblades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Cow! What the heck are these?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your roller-skates! I redesigned them! I think this new design will work even better!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are really swell! I mean swell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you wish for, Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he tells, it won't come true!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's just a bunch of baloney! We never believed that in my family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we did in my family!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wished I could meet a girl. His parents don't have a reply for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. A nice one, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One who doesn't glow in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin Webber! What a thing to say!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we'll be going up in two years. We'll know then. I'm very hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ardently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. His parents stare at him for a beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's eat our cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's dig in! They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elbows, Son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never know. You may someday dine at the White House with the president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we still have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, when we do go up...I'm going to miss this old place. How 'bout you, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Helen rises and exits.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATTERY ROOM- LATER, SAME NIGHT
dialogues.text: Helen enters and goes into the generator room. Through the glass we can see (and hear) her scream. Straightening her hair and feeling much better, she exits as Calvin strolls by wearing his tool belt. She's headed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the generator room again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.  It just fascinates me how all    these things work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you mean! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey? She turns to him. He gives her his patented thumbs up sign. CALVIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great cake!! She smiles wanely and leaves. He shuts the generator door she left open.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: The room is quiet and empty.  The star-burst WALL CLOCK on the paneling says 6:15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also empty.  And with MEAGER SUPPLIES on the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old pipes are rusted and patched. Some are leaking badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin wakes up. He looks over at Helen's bed.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: She wakes up. Then jumps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: THE RED METAL BOX
dialogues.text: that has been ticking on the wall for thirty-five years. Suddenly it STOPS TICKING and a rather annoying ALARM GOES OFF.  Calvin's hand reaches up and turns it off by throwing the lever up. ANOTHER ANGLE shows us the mechanism on the FRONT HATCHWAY switch to OPEN with a loud, vault-like move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reveals the family in their pajamas standing in front of the front hatchway and red box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...we just open this door and go up? Calvin grabs a handle and using all his strength, opens the front entrance hatch. And then must jump back when nothing but earth and rock pour into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...is that supposed to happen? His parents take a beat then race off like maniacs through the entire shelter to the back hatch door.  They knock over whatever gets in their way as they go. Adam follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where are we going?!  Is everything all right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin and Helen arrive followed by Adam who can't possibly share his parent's deep concerns. Everyone is out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we say a little prayer first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just open the door. Calvin attempts to open the big hatch, but can't.  Adam helps him.  Helen pitches in.  Slowly, with lots of squeaking, the DOOR OPENS. He steps through the hatch and flips a wall switch.  Red submarine LIGHTS COME ON.... And the service elevator is intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen steps through and embraces Calvin joyfully.  The old folks break into a dance as Adam enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, do we just go on up?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly back to business, and way too dramatic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, son! We wait for night.  Now...is precisely when... we must be at our... most cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper, but definitely tired of his B.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. Helen's eyes widen and her hand flies up to her mouth. She is just as shocked as Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen-Thomas-Webber!  Maybe we have been down here a little too long! (to Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please excuse her French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit is a French word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an archaic colloquialism, roughly meaning..."good".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! That's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...then...shit! There is a pause, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'est bon, Monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merci!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars flash by in a rare L.A. DOWNPOUR.  All that's left of Mom's is an EMPTY BUILDING with a painted-out front window and a "For Sale or Rent" sign.  There's ANOTHER SHOP attached to it CAMERA RIGHT but we can't see what it is.  The alley way on the left has always been there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO DRUNK BUMS are sharing a bottle. One of them is the Soda Jerk, now a  dissipated middle-aged man (with a tattoo on his forehead.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...all of these things...Alcoholics Anonymous...Cocaine Anonymous...Heroin Anonymous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Heroin Anonymous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! All of these things... ask you to believe in a power greater than yourself! Some sort of God on High! Well...I have lifted my eyes skyward a time or two... and I have certainly not seen anything coming from up there except a goddamn airplane -- that I can't afford to get on! The cement FLOOR of the old Malt Shop begins to QUIVER AND RUMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earthquake!  Another earthquake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her come!  Let's get this over with!  And please, if there is a God, let it be worse in Bel Air!! The Other Bum staggers to his feet and SPLITS for a back window.  Soda Jerk is fearless.  Until finally the HYDRAULIC DOORS of the back entrance SPLIT THE FLOOR with an eerie, struggling whine and LARGE CHUNKS OF CEMENT GO FLYING.  Then up comes RED SUBMARINE LIGHT followed by Calvin in his BIG YELLOW SUIT with Geiger counter ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God!  Oh, God!!  Oh,God, save me!! For I have seen the light!! Calvin raises his hand and yells through his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I come in peace!! The Soda Jerk FAINTS. Calvin, sounding like a deep sea diver and having to walk like Frankenstein, goes over to the Soda Jerk and studies his face in the light of his flashlight.  He is horrified by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, gosh... Calvin looks around the room and heads for the back.  He moves his Geiger counter around and gets a quiet (safe) reading. Then he removes a KITCHEN MATCH from a plastic container and strikes it against the wall.  The MATCH BURNS, so Calvin takes off his hood and visor and breathes the air.  It stinks in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin (out of the head gear and top of the suit) slowly pushes the door open and steps out. He's surprised to find an empty BODY SHOP behind the Malt Shop, where the avocado trees should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is my backyard? He points his flashlight around and heads for the ALLEY to his left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DERELICT CARS left over from the Body Shop sit against a fence. Calvin marvels at the cars, even in their present condition.  In a TIGHTER SHOT he studies the chrome- plated word "Toyota."   A HOMELESS MAN arrives to search through the garbage. Calvin hurries back towards the avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin emerges from the alley that separates the Malt Shop from another storefront (perhaps now a rundown Thai restaurant.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watching the cars fly by on the wet avenue.  Suddenly, a cross-dressing STREET WALKER steps up to him with a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a light, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  A light!  Yes, I've got a light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Fumbling, he finally gets her little cigar lighted with one of his kitchen matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...you...survived the blast, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blast?  Honey, I have survived a host of things. Like the song says: "A country boy can survive!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, the song.  So tell me...has it been...hell up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hell up here?"  Honey, it's been hell up here, down there and over yonder! Hell everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can tell that just looking around. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Boy?"  Did you say you were a "country boy?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute Little Old Man, if you want a boy, I can be a boy.  And if you want a girl, I can be a girl.  I can be anything you want me to be!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. And it's all yours for the remarkably low price of only $200! And if you act now, I might even throw in some free lawn furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stumbling away from her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.  I'm sorry!  I have to go!  I have to... He breaks into a trot, heading up the street past a seedy BAR (used to be the convenience store) just as a hopelessly DRUNK HAG of a woman is shoved out and told to stay out.  Calvin watches as the woman stumbles to the curb where she TOSSES her cookies.  TWO LOW RIDERS HOP BY full of TAUNTING YOUNG HISPANIC GANG MEMBERS, one of whom BRANDISHES A PISTOL and, just for fun, points it at Calvin.  When Calvin sees the pistol he ducks into the ADULT BOOKSTORE. The young gang member pulls the trigger and we (not Calvin) see that the realistic-looking pistol is really a water gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin races in and, gathering himself, addresses the PAKISTANI MAN behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!  How are you this evening?! Mind if I, you know, browse around?! The clerk just watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-Q very much! Then Calvin turns and has his first look at the material...and he GRABS HIS HEART and SCREAMS and FALLS back KNOCKING OVER a whole ROW OF VIDEOS AND MAGAZINES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin sits at the breakfast table, still breathing hard and holding his chest.  His family looks on with great concern.  The anti-radiation suit and gear is piled in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to give it to you straight. There's no point in beating around the bush. There were survivors. Apparently, the fallout has created....a subspecies of mutants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutants?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a pretty sight. Some eat out of garbage cans.  Others are...cover your ears, Son, and hum.  I mean that literally and I mean right now! ADAM covers his ears and hums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others are...multi-sexual.  It seems...they can be both masculine and feminine...simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it! Helen copes by moving around the kitchen doing things that don't need to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it. He tried to sell me his body, Helen. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They offer lawn furniture as a come on! She slumps, then resumes her needless activity.  Calvin takes Adam's arm and the son drops his hands and stops humming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've done a lot of re-building but society, at least as we knew it, has utterly collapsed. People throw up in the streets. Others point guns. There's something terribly wrong with the automobiles and...and I...I can't tell you the rest.  I just can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my. Oh,my, oh my, oh, my. So, what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. She hurries into the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen let's out a silent scream, then hurries back into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?  We've just about run out of everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll make do.  I'm of the opinion that these mutants will eventually kill each other off and then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Calvin.  We're not going to make do.  Not me!  Not Adam.  We're going up no matter what!  We deserve it. Even if it's terrible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I am the head of this household--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want him to at least see the sky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and we will--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the ocean!  A mountain range!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --do as I say! Breathing heavily, Calvin suddenly clutches at his chest in great pain and collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Oh, my goodness!   Let's get him into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam paces.  Then Helen comes out.  Behind her, we can see Calvin sleeping in his bed. She heads for the living room. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to be doing all right now.  I don't know if he's had a heart attack or just... a horrifying experience. But we  need supplies and I've got to stay with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go up. They go through the living room and cross to the patio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you've got to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting his cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my brave boy. Helen hands him a pencil and pad. Adam follows her to the fish farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just act normal.  If anybody asks, simply say you're from out-of-town, and that you're in town on business. Write that down. He does. HELEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to give you a shopping list and some money.  We need just enough things to get us through the next year or two.  And you'll find most of these items at what used to be called a grocery store or a hardware store. Write that down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. At the fish tank, Helen pulls up a slim chain that is attached to a water-tight aluminum box which she quickly opens. The box contains $6,000 in wrapped one hundred dollar bills. Helen takes half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how far you'll have to travel to find supplies, but if you can't get home by nightfall, I want you to look for something called a Holiday Inn. Write that down. It's a hotel. There might still be one standing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you packed. She heads back for the house. He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just hope this is still good up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking that, uh...you know, while I was up there and all...that maybe I could, you know...try to meet a girl.  I've, been thinking about that a little...just these last...fifteen years or so. They have stopped by the garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Adam,that would be wonderful if you could find a girl. One who's not a mutant...and hopefully comes from Pasadena. Nothing against Valley girls, but in my day anyhow, the girls from Pasadena, I don't know...always just seemed a little nicer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's also a thing called a liquor store. Write that down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is packing. He looks at his cigar box and opens it. He studies the contents: The Cards, stock certificates, and an old photo of his parents. He decides to pack the box. Helen enters with a long shopping list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the shopping list and $3,000 which should take care of everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father has a few final words for you. You know, he'd fight a buzz saw for you - he loves you so much. We both do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heck, I know that mom! You're my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sets down his suitcase and goes to his father's bed. He sits. At the door, Helen dries her eyes with her apron.  Calvin indicates that he wants to whisper to Adam, who drops his ear close to his father's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam...don't forget...don't forget ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, father?! Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the pipe tobacco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  Is that all? Calvin nods. Adam rises and starts for the door. But Calvin remembers something and beckons him back to speak weakly into his son's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also...stay out of the "Adult Bookstore."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adult Bookstore.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison gas. Invisible. Don't forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more thing. If you find a healthy young woman, bring her back with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try. And then Calvin closes his eyes and sleeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soda Jerk has turned the rear exit into a religious shrine.  He's put flowers and candles and costume jewelry and religious icons (from all the Majors) on top of and around the broken cement.  Currently he's on his knees, rocking back and forth as he prays. And,lo! There came a rumbling even as from the very bowels of the earth and a great light showed forth followed by gates of armor which opened and shut and delivered up the vision of a young man whose countenance caused the Soda Jerk to be struck dumb and to fall on his face and to weep in fear.  And, Adam, taking pity on the man, put down his suitcase, and went to him, saying:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Yes!  Oh, Lord!  Yes, oh, yes! But  where is the one who came last night -- all in yellow?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All in yellow?  Oh!  That was my father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooohhhh!!  Of course! The father! Forgive me!!  Can you forgive me for my wasted life?!  Everything has been so awful!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comforting him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it has been terrible.  But it wasn't your fault. And now all the decay is over with and things are going to get better. You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do.  I'll stay here and pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up his suitcase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's always a good idea! Would you like some money? I have a great deal of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I don't need money anymore -- I see that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I leave here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door is open.  Will you be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Adam turns and leaves. The Soda Jerk falls to his knees and shakes all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam steps out onto the sidewalk and sunlight falls on him much brighter than anything he has ever seen.  He looks at it on the arm of his coat and then, slowly, he looks up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELY CLOUDS AND BLUE SKY
dialogues.text: And now it is Adam who is dumbstruck. BYSTANDER #1 appears and sees Adam looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky?  Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look!! Adam becomes momentarily interested in a parking meter. A MOTHER and her CHILD approach from the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it, mommy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?! Several more people are drawn over. A CONVERTIBLE goes by in the foreground with passengers who are looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never in my life seen anything like this!!!! Nothing even comes close!! Adam continues down the sidewalk,looking up. A BLACK WOMAN POSTAL WORKER passes by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my holy stars! A Negro!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with attitude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leary, but taking his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good! The Pakistani exits the Adult Bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?!  What do you see?! When Adam looks down to answer the man he sees the "Adult Bookstore" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poisonous gas!!  Run for your life, it's invisible poisonous gas!!! And everyone does run away, including Adam. The avenue is left totally deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen sits sipping tea, deep in thoughts of concern for Adam. Behind her Calvin appears in the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know-- Helen is so startled she knocks the tea all over the place. CALVIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say that I think he's going to be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding her heart)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Calvin. Thank you very much. Calvin leaves, then comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, dear, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An L.A. bus comes directly at CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: is startled. He reacts.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER'S FOOT
dialogues.text: slamming down the brake pedal.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: in profile. The braking bus stops an inch from his nose. Adam smiles. (Have him head for bus door in this angle.)

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: from over Adam. He is in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start on a MOVING STEADY CAM SHOT on Adam's POV of bus passengers as he heads for a seat. The passengers look at him in amazement and some fear.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: going to his seat; smiling at the passengers. (He is carrying a $100 bill.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! Hi. Good afternoon! Howdy. Adam finds a seat next to a heavily perspiring young PSYCHO HEROIN ADDICT.

dialogues.speaker: THEM
dialogues.text: Adam shows the Psycho the $100 bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to give the driver this but he wouldn't take it. He seems angry. A lot of people do. The bus pulls out. It gets up to about twenty miles an hour. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy! Here we go! We're moving! Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking back at Adam with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is public transportation. My Dad says that it becomes more and more important because of pollution -- which is more and more carbon dioxide and other hazardous gases in the air. (then, confidentially)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a gun, by the way? The increasingly nervous Psycho looks around, then nods that he does. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for not waving it around. And for not vomitting, for that matter. Wow, we're really flying. Say, do you know where I could find a grocery store? The psycho shakes his head. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to find that. And a hardware store  and a liquour store and a standing Holiday Inn. Although, I may not need the Holiday Inn. That's still kind of up in the air. It depends really on how things go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a grocery store coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-Q! (jumping up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver! Please stop the bus immediately! I have to get off! (then an aside to the psycho)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I should get a gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (back to driver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver! Please stop, sir!

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER IN THE REAR VIEW
dialogues.text: He's not going to stop until he wants to stop. ANGLE - OLD JEWISH COUPLE PASSENGERS. who are anxious for Adam to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the love of God! Let him off the bus!! Can't you see he's meshugina! Adam leans in close to the OLD MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, what did you call me? The man and his wife take that the wrong way and start to scream.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER'S FOOT
dialogues.text: hitting the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: stopping suddenly. Through the windows we see Adam go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door opens as Adam gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, driver! Good-bye, everyone! Adam exits the bus. Everyone, including the Psycho, heaves a huge sign of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam enters and (after getting over the automatic doors and the check-out technology) is overwhelmed by the magnificence of the postmodern California supermarket. The check-out counters alone are amazing. Seeing others do it, he takes a cart, placing his suitcase in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam passes the baked goods, paying particular attention to the elaborate birthday cakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a birthday cake?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee-ma-nee! Adam leaves. The clerk turns to a fellow worker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bakersfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam marvels at the abundance and variety. He passes a mother whose child is riding in the cart and that reminds him of his own mom -- when she used to let him ride that way.  Then he is surprised to see a MIDDLE-AGED COUPLE so casually dressed in public. She (overweight) is in an unfortunate terrycloth halter-shorts combination.  He (hirsute) is in a sleeveless undershirt and baggy bathing trunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first mutants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam picks up one of those huge California cucumbers that always amaze Easterners.  He shows it to the JAPANESE- AMERICAN CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this because of the radiation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is looking at the live lobsters as a BUTCHER steps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please. (consulting his Mom's list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for all beef patties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fresh or frozen? Adam chuckles because he thinks the man is kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Frozen. How much are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen, they're six-thirty a dozen in the three pound box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll need, twelve into nine hundred, seventy-five boxes. And that's almost...five hundred dollars just for the hamburger! And my Mom only gave me three thousand dollars for everything! The yacht batteries! The diesel oil! The birthday candles!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could have a meat order that big delivered to your home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's great then! Terrific...except...it just occurred to me. I don't know where I live! I'm lost! I don't know where home is! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gladly. Adam hurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Adam on another bus. He looks frantically out the window. We see his POV of shops and stores and people. At one point he sees two women joggers which he wonders about. Then he sees two men arguing violently. Gradually late day turns to night and Adam becomes more and more depressed. Then he sees something. He is elated. He jumps up and tells the driver:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driver! Stop this bus immediately! Please sir!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus stops mid-block and Adam gets off. He crosses the street causing only one car to hit the brakes. On the other side of the avenue we see what has gotten his attention. It's an ADULT BOOKSTORE much like the last one we saw (probably owned by the same chain.) He's happy but when he looks next door he sees he's in a different place. Sad and lost he turns north and starts to walk until -- a billboard catches his attention. We pan up to see a billboard for liposuction that features an almost NUDE WOMAN. Adam is struck by the image and we spend some time cutting between him and it. Then gathering himself he turns and begins to walk south.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of him as he passes a BODY PIERCING STORE and wonders about that. Then he sees something that blows his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of a STRAY DOG passing by. Adam reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my. Oh, my goodness gracious! Oh, my...Oh. That is so great!! Man alive!

dialogues.speaker: CU OF BASEBALL CARDS STORE WINDOW
dialogues.text: A sign says: COMIC BOOKS & BASEBALL CARDS BOUGHT, SOLD & TRADED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam enters with his suitcase in one hand and his cigar box in the other.  He steps up to the counter where the owner (JERRY) sits reading the newspaper. He has a fondness for Navajo jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gives him a look, then goes back to reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. A YOUNG WOMAN enters from the back of the store and goes to another counter.  Neither man notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is Adam Webber and I see you buy baseball cards and although these are a lot older than the ones in the window, I was hoping you still might be interested. He flips open the cigar box to reveal to Jerry riches beyond his wildest dreams.  Jerry actually moans and then must pretend the moan was a cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How--how much do you want for the Mickey Mantle, rookie season?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of selling all the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? No kidding? He reaches in and looks through the cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, my problem is, all I have are hundred dollar bills and I need something smaller.  Ones, fives, tens. Like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see what ya mean. Tell you what...I'll give you five hundred dollars in small bills for the whole box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that would be wonderful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're here to help! A woman steps into the shot. She has come from the back of the store and her back is momentarily to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Adam turns to her and is immediately awe struck. We reveal EVE RUSTOKOV. She tosses her lipstick into her purse. Eve works in the card shop and is on her way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm workin' here, Evey-poo.  Don't screw me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bon soir, mademoiselle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you French?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (then, thinking fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from out of town. (then sensing the need for further clarification)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here on business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, your business must not be sports memorabilia, because this one Mantle card right here-- (holds up a card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --is worth six thousand dollars all by its little self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you get out of here. She closes his cigar box and gives it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific...you're fired! You know that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ferry--excuse me, Jerry, I quit. She walks back to the counter to get her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! I fired ya! Just like the hair salon guy and the Chevy dealer!  You know why you can't keep a goddamn job?!  Because you can't keep your goddamn mouth shut!  That's why! Jerry is surprised when Adam suddenly takes his arm firmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir? I would really appreciate it if you wouldn't take the Lord's name in vain again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Adam's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a big problem with that. Eve sees a fist fight coming. She takes Adam by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Heathcliff, I'll walk you to the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.  But my name is Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just come on. They head for the door and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah!  Adam and Eve!  The perfect match!  I hope you two will be very happy together!  Mazel-fuckin'-tov! Don't try coming back, Ms. Big Shot! I'm serious this time! You're finished in the hobby business! Take that to the bank, why don'tcha! Adam re-enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to leave without saying how much I admire your jewelry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, smart ass, how 'bout I kick your butt? Adam walks towards the man smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout you what? Jerry takes a nervous step backwards, but Eve steps back in and pulls Adam out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said come on! Adam exits. Jerry doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? I'm going home. And, judging by that coat, I'd say you have to get back to the barber college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say,...did you just lose your job because of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  I'm sick of working for that dickhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dickhead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A walking penis capable of intelligent speech.  A dickhead. A mental picture of that causes Adam to slump against a store window and drop his box of cards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had a mental picture of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, pick these up! Together they pick up the cards. EVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you parked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came on a bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why doesn't that surprise me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why doesn't it? They rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess because I'm a little psychic...I have this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
