dialogues.text: Let me guess something. This is your first visit to La La Land. You're staying somewhere over in Hollywood because, like an idiot, you thought that would be an exciting place to stay.  Right so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (could be a question, could be an answer.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it! So anyhow, you get on a bus and before you know it, you're out here in the San Fernando Valley without a clue.  Which brings us to here.  Correct again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you staying? The Holiday Inn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes! The Holiday Inn! That's exactly right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? I'm psychic. Not completely, but pretty much. That was pretty good, wasn't it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Thanks. Anyhow, let me predict a bus for you to get on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you own a car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking you there, Sweetie. Rule Number One in North America: No strangers in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it will make you feel any better, I don't have a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that changes everything. Get the fuck away from me!!  I mean it!! She races around the corner.  He goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry!  I said something wrong, didn't I!  Please forgive me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!! She runs into a parking lot.  He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Please wait!  I'll make a deal with you!  I'll give you a Rogers Hornsby, if you'll take me to the hotel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers Hornsby?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all yours. I was holding him back. Adam takes a Hornsby card from his coat pocket and shows it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rogers Hornsby's worth like four thousand dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?!  I've got two of him! (removing more cards from his pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this many DiMaggios and Robinsons. I was holding these out, too. She arrives at her car (dirty GEO) and anxiously unlocks the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So for four thousand dollars, all I have to do is drive you to your hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to take a physical in your space ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heck, no!  What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  What the hell?  You got a deal. Get in. She gets in. He gets in the back seat behind her. EVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front seat! He runs around to the front while Eve chats with herself. EVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I doing this? What in the hell is wrong with me? That's what I'd like to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is moving at fifteen miles an hour. The dash lights fascinate him but the car scares him.  She notices that he is gripping the seat belt for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...Mister Andretti, your first time on the freeway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Webber.  Adam Webber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I change the station? Better traffic reports on AM. She switches over to AM and runs by a Perry Como record, "Round and Round", looking for traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Perry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perry Como!  You had him!  Go back! Go back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay!  Take it easy! She gets Perry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (star-struck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I could die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Listen to this part. This is where it really takes off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are one scary son-of-a-gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve's car splits for the exit ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sudden speed scares Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a short-cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes off, catches the light and whips onto the surface street, tires squealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam is hanging onto his seat belt. Eve puts the pedal to the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee-zooie!!  You better slow down!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it. Perry Como always does this to me! I just get so cranked! She turns Perry way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve does a dandy job of trading lanes and passing.  The little Geo's engine screams. Adam's sort of getting into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Geo flies up to a quick stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve turns to Adam, who has had A Life Experience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Card, please.  End of service. He hands over the card like someone in a post-sex stupor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was...wonderful!  I've never felt anything like that in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, same here. Don't forget your suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. He gets out with the suitcase, and after shutting the door leans down to speak to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know-- She tears off, leaving him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam addresses the clerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. I want to stay at this hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fill this out please. And I'll need a card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! Adam gives him a baseball card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BELLBOY ushers Adam in and sets down his bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bathroom's there, TV's over there. Remote's on top. Room Service menu is on the table. Adam picks up the phone and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dial nine to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then he hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.  Well, thank you very much. You've been very, very nice. He offers two dollars. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was able to get some change downstairs and my father taught me that it's customary to tip in a situation such as this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Your father is a smart guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father is a genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin'. Well...good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night!  Sleep tight.  Don't let the bedbugs bite!  That's what my Mom always says... (choking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...who I'm really beginning to miss. I'm sorry.  It's my first night away from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't look thirty-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-five? Around there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess living up here makes people look older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here on the fifteenth floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Up here on the fifteenth floor. Goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Adam abruptly shuts the door in the man's face. He goes to the window and looks out. The height scares him to death. He jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's parents pray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lord we ask finally that you send an angel to look after and protect our beloved son, Adam.  Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen. She begins to tear up and he pats her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam sits by the window watching his first dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's another bright, smoggy day.  And here comes Eve, marching from the parking garage to the hotel entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skyward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the hell am I doing here?! That's what I'd like to know! Somebody tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is speaking to a DESK CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that his first name is Adam.  No!  Adam Webber!  That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is seated on the bed, transfixed, watching a television commercial.The PHONE RINGS loudly.  Adam nearly jumps out of his skin.  After he figures out where the ringing is coming from, he answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone, after a long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the house phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. This is the woman from the baseball card store.  Remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, is he glad to hear from her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!  Hello!  Hi!  Hot-diggity-dog! Thank you for calling me on the telephone!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve holds the receiver away from her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good grief. Hey listen, I'm in the lobby. (pause, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the first floor! Where the hell else would it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and Adam hurries out, looking for Eve, who he sees and goes directly to, smiling all the while like a rumpled idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so glad to see you!!  I thought I'd never see you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, down boy. (holds up the baseball card) I can't take this for driving you home. I wish I could, but I can't. So here, take it back. I could have just left it for you at the desk, but it's very valuable. Now take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it. damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with hand over his mouth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. He takes the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't brushed yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Well, so long. Enjoy your visit. She heads for the front door.  He goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Eve, please!  Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't follow me.  Don't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this would happen!  You're like a lost puppy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you please just talk to me for one second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Damn! She stops, he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have taken the money and run! That's what Troy told me to do!  But do I listen?  No! Put your hand down! He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy? Is he your husband? Or a boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes to heaven)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-Q!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, stop that!  God! Listen, I know you like me.  I can tell. But you know what? A lot of guys like me.  Not me, exactly. It's more like the legs or the butt or the hair.  Or some combination of the above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyes.  Okay. An eye-man.  Anyhow, it never works out.  Okay?  Not that you even need to know that!  You look like crap, by the way.  What have you been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching television in color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no kidding?  In color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross my heart and hope to die. She looks at him for a beat or two, then abruptly turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why doesn't it never work out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does it never work out?  You and...men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!  Who the hell knows?! He follows closely. She stops. EVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if you promise to leave me alone, I'll tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never works out because I'm into legs and butts and hair myself! That's why! So I wind up with guys who are very good looking, but even more shallow than I am, if you can picture that. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to go find another low-paying, demeaning job where some guy named Jerry keeps telling me how lousy his marriage is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not go to work for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling all my baseball cards. And helping me buy enough food and supplies to fill several large trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food and supplies?  Who for?  Like starving people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're not starving yet, but they need help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long would you need me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's fair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to make at least a thousand a week. He gives her his patented thumbs up sign which of course is exactly like his father's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it! Wait here while I change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. He walks back to the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My career's finally taking off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavy-duty BOAT BATTERIES are being loaded into a U-Haul truck.  The store MANAGER steps up to Eve who is watching. Adam appears in the bg, thanking and being nice to the MEN loading the truck. He looks mighty stupid in another one of his Dad's old outfits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would someone need twenty yacht batteries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just work for the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who does he work for?  The CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw...it's some sort of charity thing..I guess for starving people with yachts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Adam shop with two carts, both full of CASES OF DR. PEPPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not buy them milk or something-- instead of Dr. Pepper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They like Dr. Pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Mom and Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very funny, smart ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Pipe tobacco!  I'm going to need all of this! This is swell! He goes over to a huge supply of Prince Albert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell? Run, Eve.  Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Adam watch as a man with a forklift puts a year's supply of toilet paper into the back of the rental truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd has gathered to watch Adam and Eve empty seven shopping carts full of non-perishable groceries.

dialogues.speaker: 5 MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Eve goes to get into the truck. Adam hurries by her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He opens the door for her. She shakes her head and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives the truck to a stop. He keeps the beat to the song on the AM radio. It's VolarГ€. Adam loves it. Eve hates it. They come to a stop and she snaps off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, another day, another dollar. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop staring at me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. He gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick you up at eight tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know. I was thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night! She pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam drags the last 50-pound bag of flour into a self- storage locker and pulls down the sliding door which he padlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to rent a refrigerated truck for the beef and poultry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your life.  And, by the way, it's a dandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we'll need another locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.  We'll just sell another baseball card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Eve -- don't get mad, okay? - -  but, I'd just be lost without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, um ...I guess... I guess you and I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam?  Don't even think about it. Okay? I'm sorry.  I know that sounds mean, but believe me, it would be meaner if I didn't say it. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, let's take the truck back and get something to eat. She hops in behind the wheel.  He (hurt) is a little slower getting in his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traffic is moving about forty miles an hour.  Their truck is in one of the middle lanes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam screws up his guts and turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else I would like you to help me with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is going to sound a little crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sure it will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no!  I'm sorry!  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of me as your genie.  Just ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... Okay. I would like you to help me find a...wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to get married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be single and not alone. Marriage bites!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bites what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody knows that. Ask my divorced sisters. Or ask my divorced mom and dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all divorced?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't used to be that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't know. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of wife are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One who's not a mutant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No dogs, huh? Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if possible, I'd like to marry someone from Pasadena. She is speechless. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When do you need her by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could probably get you laid in two weeks, but to locate a non-mutant wife from Pasadena...that could take some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Eve are in a booth. The WAITRESS approaches with sandwiches and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, you can get me laid? He and the waitress look to Eve for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we talk about that a little later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sugary, to waitress)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The amazed waitress leaves.  Adam automatically lowers his head and says grace.  Two HAPPENIN' GUYS at the counter look over and chuckle at the rube.  Eve flips them a mean bird and mouths the words "fuck you" as Adam continues to pray. The guys shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve shares a frame Santa Monica bungalow.  It's in a pretty nice neighborhood on a quiet street.  Her GEO FISHTAILS into the picture and comes to rest half in the street, half on the curb.  Adam is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engine is still running. She rips the keys out of the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, get out!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that ma'am crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry! They get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You almost got us killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I've never driven before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never drive again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it would be easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. She storms off for the house where a YOUNG MAN is coming out the front door in a cut-off T-shirt and spandex exercise shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLIFF is leaving with a cardboard box full of clothes. He is exceedingly GOOD LOOKING AND IN VERY GOOD SHAPE. Eve and Adam come up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you bitching about now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot some of my stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your stuff?  Let me see that. She looks in the box.  Holds up a pair of old briefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, they're Ralph Laurens.  And who's this interesting looking fellow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Adam.  Adam, meet Cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do fine, Adam.  How 'bout yourself? (eyeing Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You doin' any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Cliff, wherever that might be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shana Gillroy's apartment.  Remember her?  The model who went to Harvard? Well, I better get going!  Bye, Adam. Nice coat! Cliff smiles and bounces down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, thank you!  Very nice to have met you, Cliff! (then to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a former boyfriend. We lived together for about six months.  And yes, I'll admit it.  I've still kind of got a thing for him. (entering the house)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you wanted to know, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (following)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually,no. I was wondering why Cliff likes to wear another man's underpants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good music is playing. Adam listens to one speaker then crosses to listen to the other. Then he goes back to the first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is pouring champagne into a glass that contains two sugar cubes.  Next she adds several dashes of bitters. TROY, HER GAY ROOMMATE, throws together a tray of appetizers as dinner cooks on the stove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve!  This guy is un-be-liev-able!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlin', this is X-File stuff!  Think about it!  The guy's got all this easily negotiable property. He's obviously setting something up very big.  Like a self-sustaining island off the coast of South America, for instance. Or perhaps he's the head of a cult that's doing weird things with poultry and pipe tobacco. I've heard worse. He rushes out with the tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy enters with sushi appetizers. Adam is looking at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have very nice ceilings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do? Well, thank you! You like ceilings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope you like these! Fresh sea urchin wrapped in seaweed. Or "nori" if you prefer. I love sushi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Lucy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nut! Eve enters with Adam's drink and two white wines. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.  One champagne cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-Q!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought only hookers drank those things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I know Mom sure likes 'em! Eve and Troy look at each other as she hands him his wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner in fifteen minutes. Why don't we sit and chat. They do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Adam...where on earth are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out-of-town.  That's all he'll say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a very small place. People don't even know it's there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's called...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Eve can guess.  She's psychic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since that guy rear-ended me in Palm Springs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even guessed his hotel, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Dionne Warwick, guess his home town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... Adam holds out his hand and she takes it, rubbing her finger slowly and gently around in his palm.  For her, it's psychic stuff.  For him, it's spine-tingling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's see...I'm not promising anything. You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um-hum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm seeing...snow... lots of snow. Way up North.  Are we getting hot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live in...Alaska.  The only way in or out of your place is by plane and... you've definitely come down here for food and supplies and... to find a wife!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. She tosses back his hand and grabs her wine for a victory gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met anyone like you in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, butthead, I'm clairvoyant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got goose-bumps all over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not just go to... Nome for supplies and a wife?  Isn't that closer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right!  That's where you'd go to find girls!  Nome.  He's gay, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we try. Listen, let me just ask you a few questions.  When did Alaska become a state?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who use to own it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did we get it from them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1867.  Seward's Folly. We paid 7.2 million dollars for it. A tidy sum then, as well as now. I'm quoting my father, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the capitol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Juneau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! It's Anchorage!  Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, that's the largest city. Troy jumps up and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone to check your answers on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a computer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We keep it in the backyard.  Of course, in the house.  It's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I please be excused?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TROY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: He has "Alaska" on his computer screen.  Adam enters and looks at the computer, which captivates him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be very new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? This is the new Mac. You a hacker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a computer in your cabin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you get through those winters? (reading screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're right.  Juneau. (then, covering the screen with his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the highest peak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mt. McKinley.  It's also the highest point in North America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after peeking at the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe she is psychic.  Let's go eat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating computer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would knock my father out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would probably kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a Windows guy then, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He likes windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think Windows stink. What do you think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I guess it's...just a matter of personal taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True. Troy exits. Adam follows. (EDITORIAL:  Scenes 131, 132, and 133 should follow scene 134 rather than precede it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin Webber is sleeping soundly.  Helen stands quietly at the door looking at him. She finishes off her champagne cocktail and very quietly shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen goes into the elevator. Obviously, she's had too much to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floor rumbles and the metal doors open emitting the red light.  Soda Jerk and TEN OF HIS FOLLOWERS stand up expectantly and anxiously.  Helen appears--and looks at this terribly odd assortment of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the mother!! And they all fall down on their knees and worship her with much wailing and rejoicing.  Several speak in tongues. Helen stares at them wide-eyed, presses the button on the control box, and goes back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam's impeccable table manners serve to highlight Eve's and Troy's utter lack of same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first, you have to start with the clothes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. (then to Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand that, don't you?  You have no chance of meeting a woman dressed like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Troy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you seeing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking Adam over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money is no object.  He's got cards up the wazoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wazoo!  Try to listen. (then to Troy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whataya think? Surfer, grunge, hip- hop, Euro trash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means that your taste in men's apparel is as bad as your taste in men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's blunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. But if the shoe fits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I suppose you see him in some sort of strapless  thing, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see "elegant."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Like Ralph Lauren?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm sensing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy with the underpants!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's boring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not wearing his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not? He has great pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you take him and pick out his clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking with her mouth full)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm busy tomorrow anyway. I have to buy six thousand paper napkins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About clothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you two want. If you've got the time, I've got the wazoo. Eve and Troy watch him eat for a beat or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a little tiring to sit up straight like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about holding your right arm up like that all the time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. Just give it a try. And for gosh sake, Eve, take your foot off the chair! She does. Eve and Troy emulate Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Adam get out of Eve's car with a lot of packages. They head for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess a lot of those tall buildings we saw this morning are new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recovery is very impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The recovery? Oh , yeah! Hey, they rebuilt the freeway in six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. I'm very impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is on the couch doing her toenails when Adam and Troy enter. Adam is in a casually elegant outfit that looks terrific. Both he and Troy are carrying lots of other packages and garment bags. We see names like Gucci, Armani and Lauren. Eve is visibly impressed by Adam's makeover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think...it...works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you the entire trousseau!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first let me show her these! He reaches into a bag and removes a box that contains -- a pair of rollerblades. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve, can I skate around your block?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making it sexual)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout it, Eve? Can he skate around your block?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a most unusual band shell location on the beach that is completely covered by graffiti. Eve and Troy sit at one of the many stone tables watching Adam skate all over the place. He wears spandex workout pants and a T- shirt. The starting CRANE SHOT begins on the nearly deserted commercial section of Venice Beach and then takes us to the band shell.

dialogues.speaker: CLOSER
dialogues.text: of him skating and them watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to kill himself. (then, to Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go skate out on the bike path! It's that way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! He heads out of the band shell. We follow him as he skates into an area that has been given over to the homeless. They sit around in their sleeping bags and blankets and cheer (and jeer) Adam when he passes by. He takes them to be more mutants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam skates to it and is amazed to see two very pretty girls skating in their tiny bikinis. A nearly nude body- builder guy goes by on a bike. Then Adam sees the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: WAVES
dialogues.text: breaking on the beach and rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam tosses off his roller-blades and walks trance-like towards the waves.

dialogues.speaker: TROY AND EVE
dialogues.text: appear on a dune behind him and watch.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Adam raises his arms to greet the ocean, perhaps like a Plains Indian would. Then he joyously runs into the surf and dives.

dialogues.speaker: TROY AND EVE
dialogues.text: watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That water's freezing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's from Alaska.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: He surfaces and throws his fists in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why little things mean so much to him.

dialogues.speaker: I LOVE THIS
dialogues.text: Begin the record "YMCA" over this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve enters from her morning shower to find Troy and Adam goofing to The Village People song. She gives Troy a disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! He wanted to hear some standards! (My hip daughters tell me that "YMCA" is enjoying a huge rebirth of popularity at their parties. Apparently they line dance to it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A helicopter shot follows the U-Haul in traffic. (Continue music.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Eve fill a second storage site. (Continue music.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the infield of a gay softball team wheel a double play.

dialogues.speaker: TROY AND ADAM
dialogues.text: Cheering the play with other gay fans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it! I finally get it! You have to see it to understand it! Music ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out the back window at the rain and shakes her head. She exits the back door with an umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve hurries to Adam who is sitting on a lawn chair in the middle of the small back yard, enjoying the rain. She holds the umbrella over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Eve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever heard the saying, "He hasn't got enough sense to come in out of the rain?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. (then watching the rain hit the palm of his hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my father -- who is a scientist -- says that everything is a miracle. Everything. Until recently I wasn 't sure what he meant by that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? No kidding. Listen, you still want to go girl hunting tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I certainly do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. But you know, this business of finding you a wife -- it's kind of ridiculous, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes it is. A girlfriend maybe. But a wife? I mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just help me find a girlfriend! That's all I ask. I'll give you every single card I've got left!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, screw you! Okay? You think I'm just somebody you can buy off! Listen, let me tell you something--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her by the arms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you do it just because you're my friend? My very best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...yeah. Okay. He hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank Q, Eve! She's uncomfortable with the hug. Wait a minute. No she's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hip, up-market club is based on a 1940's theme. Establish the YOUTHFUL RICH arriving in their black four- wheel vehicles and silver Porsches. Coats and ties. Eve, Troy and Adam arrive on foot. Adam notices the valet parking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you park way back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Rustokov refuses to let total strangers drive her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I see. Eve looks like she owns the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter Adam grabs Troy, who is leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies first, Troy! That was close. Adam and Troy follow Eve in. The club is NOISY AND HOPPING. The house music is from the 40's. Adam, Eve and Troy enter a long corridor of booths and walk forward. Adam's got on that terrific dark suit. Women notice. Eve notices them noticing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness gracious!  This place is something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bored even. Adam gives it a shot and goes too bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vaguely bored! He gets vaguely bored but misses unimpressed by a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unimpressed, but still interested. He tries that. It's like watching a neon sign switch back and forth:  First interested, then not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Not crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be loose. He overplays that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always good advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For him. It doesn't work for the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Mo-ly, Miss Pay-o-ly!! This place is neat-o!! Adam enters the main room. Eve and Troy follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a bar, a seated section, and a dance floor with a DJ booth. The DJ is in a white dinner jacket and does a perfect Humphrey Bogart impression as he ad libs his speel between records.

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: JASON and JONATHAN wave when they see Eve and Troy approaching. They ad-lib hellos. Here, and at the tables, the recorded MUSIC IS SO LOUD THEY MUST SPEAK OVER IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason, Jonathan, this is Adam! Adam, that's them! They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?! It's very nice to meet you, Jason and Jonathan! (confidentially, to them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother always told me that if you meet a person for the first time it's easier to remember their names if you use those names right away. Jason and Jonathan just stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's from Alaska!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! A slightly drunk beauty named SOPHIE appears behind Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, there, Eve, who's the hunk? Eve hates Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost, Sophie. Sophie pushes her way right up to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sophie, I'm Adam Webber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam lives in Alaska.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tu parle Francais? Tu a un tres bon accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak beautiful French! J'ai habitГ€ a Paris un an.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris!! La ville de lumieres! C'est bien rencontrer quelqu'un pour pratiquer le francais.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si tu veux, nous pouvons pratiquer beaucoup des choses ensemble. Eve steps in and takes Adam's hand, drawing him away from Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit showing off!  We're here on business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non, cherie. A bientot. Eve leads Adam to a table. Troy follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was here to meet women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And don't be so obvious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Eve and Troy examine female patrons over drinks. It's white wine for her, imported beer for Troy, and a Rob Roy for Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you ordered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Rob Roy. A very popular drink, I'm told.

dialogues.speaker: LOVELY BRUNETTE
dialogues.text: slinking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?!  I think she's very attractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam!  She's got bitch written all over her!  You do know what "bitch" means, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have a dictionary. But I can't understand for the life of me why you would call her that!  Or why Cliff would say that about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're bitches!  Look at her! Look at the expression on her face! The walk, the jewelry, the fingernails.  Please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout this one? "This one" is a KILLER BLOND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?!  You wouldn't even be a crumb on her table!  You don't see that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm trying to educate him!  It's nothing personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam,  I think for you, we should go for "sweet."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swigging her drink)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sweet.  That's a nice way of putting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Troy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I say to Miss Sweet when I meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Eve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so much what you say but how you say it.  Women like men who are unpredictable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, really! Basically, they want what they think they can't have.  Same with guys.  That's why everybody is walking around here sending off "you can't have me" signals!

dialogues.speaker: MEN AND WOMEN
dialogues.text: doing precisely that. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. But that's how it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yeah.  Could be.  Go say hello, Romeo. Looks like a healthy non-mutant to me.

dialogues.text: Okay. All right. (then)

dialogues.text: And what do I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Yes! Lying is always a very effective dating tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you, my friends. Adam rises. ADAM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: I'm not sure I want to watch this. Eve puts her hand to her head -- hating herself and still not  sure exactly why.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM

dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprising and funny. Well, I know a duck who bought some lip balm...

dialogues.text: Adam sheepishly approaches Miss Sweet, then gathers himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not sweet)

dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering if you might help me. I...I seem to have lost my Congressional Medal of Honor somewhere around here. Miss Sweet stares at him for a beat or two, then chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now, that's a great one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little clap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank-Q! They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: EVE AND TROY
dialogues.text: Stunned...as they watch Adam and Miss Sweet. Another pretty young woman (HEATHER) joins Adam.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM AND GIRLS
dialogues.text: Heather is a friend of Miss Sweet's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my new friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Adam Webber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's really funny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!  I'm Heather!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Heather?"  I don't believe I've ever heard that name before. There's a slight beat before both girls laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you!  He's funny!

dialogues.text: You dance?

dialogues.text: I took a dance lesson everyday of my life until a couple of days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not! My mom taught me.

dialogues.text: Your mom was a dancer?

dialogues.text: She is a dancer! And a lovely one! You would like her very much! Shall we dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: TROY AND EVE
dialogues.text: watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, he's a very, very good--

dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: DANCE FLOOR/ EVE
dialogues.text: Adam dances beautifully with the two women. We CUT BACK AND FORTH between them and Eve.

dialogues.text: Adam, Miss Sweet and Heather complete their dance with great aplomb.  Other dancers applaud them. Someone is WHISTLING LOUDLY OFF CAMERA.  Adam and his dance partners look over to:

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: She is whistling like a guy calling his dog.  Troy is embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must you... Eve points at Adam and beckons broadly for him to come over -- a basketball coach calling her player off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What in the hell is wrong with you?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your girl friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Would you please excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll please come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will certainly try.  And thank you both very much for the dance. He leaves.

dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw manners like that?

dialogues.text: Yeah.  It's like meeting a foreigner or something.

dialogues.speaker: TABLE
dialogues.text: as Adam comes over. The music is not so loud now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Troy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here? (then, off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're being so bossy I wasn't sure! Troy rises and exits.  Adam arrives and sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not from Alaska!  Where'd you learn to dance like that?!  And there are no starving people, are there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you suddenly so mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't change the subject! I want you to tell me the truth about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never lied to you.  I've maybe let you believe things that you wanted to believe, but I've never lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm some sort of sap?! Don't you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I admire you.  I...I fell in love with you the first time I saw you. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. I think that you are the most--

dialogues.text: I want to know exactly who you are and what you're really up to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Let me tell you the whole thing. In 1962--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well, well.  Don't we clean up nice? Cliff steps up to the table.  Adam, automatically a gentleman, rises and offers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Cliff, how are you this evening? Cliff barely shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. Then he sits in Adam's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do miss that green sport coat of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much. But, Cliff, that's my seat. And I was just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a drink at the bar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They rise.  Cliff gestures to the chair.

dialogues.text: It's all yours. Eve and Cliff go to the bar.  Adam sits down glumly.  He looks across the room and catches the eye of Miss Sweet who is seated at a table with Heather.  A GOOD LOOKING GUY is hitting on them.  CUTTING BACK AND FORTH between Adam and them we see Miss Sweet's smile escalate.  Then she nudges Heather who also looks over and smiles. Adam smiles back.  Finish with a CLOSER SHOT OF HIS POV of Miss Sweet's hair, butt and legs.

dialogues.text: Eve and Cliff are in cozy conversation at the bar. Jonathan, Jason, and Sophie are in the bg. ANGLE - Troy returning from the restroom.  He is surprised to see Eve at the bar with Cliff.  When he looks back at the dance floor table, Adam is not there.

dialogues.speaker: EVE AND CLIFF
dialogues.text: Sipping wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is your roommate, the model?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't know.  And looking at you, I don't care.  It's been too long, Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please excuse this interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam steps closer, looking past Cliff at Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve, I don't mean to be rude, and please excuse me Cliff, but Eve, isn't Cliff just a butt with hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, and legs. Legs, butt and hair.  Well, isn't he?  And shallow, as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the shallowest guy in the world)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shallow? I'm shallow?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Adam.  Go to your hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Before I kick your ass. He gives Adam a shove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cliff, I must warn you. I know how to defend myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do ya? Cliff throws a right which Adam calmly blocks and counters with a short right jab to Cliff's mouth, snapping his head back.  It's not a big punch, but very, very quick. It makes Eve mad and astonishes Troy, Jason and Jonathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, you two!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly insecure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we shouldn't fight in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I agree. Cliff draws back another right.  Adam flicks out a quick left to Cliff's cheek, again snapping his head back, but not his body. (These aren't big movie hits.) Cliff takes a beat or two then draws back his right fist again.  Adam pops him in the nose. Cliff drops his right arm to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (increasingly insecure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't fight at all. Fighting is pretty immature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowering his guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It certainly is.  I agree with you completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve? I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve, I'm sorry. Seeing an opportunity, Cliff rears back with another right. Adam deftly pops him in the mouth again with a short right jab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deeply insecure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good night, everyone. Troy, Jonathan and Jason say good night to him.  Cliff walks unsteadily away bleeding from the mouth and both nostrils. (Hopeful that no one has noticed that he's very subtly just gotten the crap beat out of him.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Eve, I would--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tomorrow maybe Troy will help you out--because I quit!  This is ridiculous! You're ridiculous! I'm ridiculous! She exits. Adam looks over at Troy who shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy takes out his keys as he approaches the front door. But the door opens. Eve stands there in sweats. Agitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He go back to the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh..he might of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy enters. She slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did not leave together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did he leave with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm his pimp. He left with the dancers, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're the psychic. Eve, the psychic pimp.  You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those sluts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But who's not a slut these days? He enters the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She follows him: He gets something to drink. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm not the one who's in love with the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!  Now hold on!  Wait one damn minute! Troy exits into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plops down on the chair. .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the first place, I don't fall in love with weirdos I've only known for four or five days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't fall in love with grown men who collect baseball cards!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yes, you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or pee in their pants when they see the ocean!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or have perfect table manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I asked him about that. And he said that good manners are a way we have of showing other people that we respect them. See, you'd eat like a slob if you were alone, but since another human being is present, you show that person respect by going to the trouble of having proper manners. I didn't know that. I thought it was a way of appearing superior. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what else he told me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting on the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks that I am a gentleman and that you are a lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, consider the source. I don't even know what a lady is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! I thought a gentleman was somebody who owned horses. Turns out, the short and very simple definition of a gentleman or a lady is: someone who always attempts to make the people around him or her feel as comfortable as possible. That's it! If you don't do that, nothing else matters. The cars, the clothes, the houses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did he get all that information?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the oddest place. His parent's told him. I don't think I got that memo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now I suppose he's trying to make those two dancers feel as comfortable as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't leave with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I admit it. I'm glad to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left with Sophie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.  She swept him out the door whispering little French things into his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Not Sophie! No way! Please don't tell me that!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? Go over to her place and kick in the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're goddamn right I am! She exits, then sticks her hand back in. EVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coming?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cringing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coward! She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentleman coward, to you.

dialogues.text: Eve hurries out of the house leaving the front door wide open.  She runs down the porch steps, across the yard, and to her car, which she unlocks with the usual fumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  Come on, damn it!

dialogues.text: She jumps in and sticks the key in the ignition.  Adam appears at the passenger window.

dialogues.text: Hi! Eve SCREAMS BLOODY MURDER as she throws open her door and jumps out into the street where she falls down, hurting her knee.  Adam runs around the car to help her to her feet. Dogs start barking in several houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scare me, why don't you?!!?  You stupid son of a bitch!!!

dialogues.text: I'm really sorry!

dialogues.text: What in the hell are you doing here!! You're supposed to be over on San Vicente Boulevard having unsafe sex with that slut Sophie!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...and I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you should be!  Thanks to you, my heart is in my neck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight! Eve marches, with a limp, back to the house.

dialogues.text: Eve, if you'll let me, I can --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! I'm limping!  How attractive is that?!  What if this is for life?!

dialogues.text: I know first aid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Is that what you call it?

dialogues.text: "All at once am I--several stories high-- knowing I'm--on the street-- where you live."  It's about a young man who is overjoyed just to be standing in front of the house of the person he loves. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam...dumb question, but humor me. Have you ever had sex before?

dialogues.text: No. She sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that possible? During the following speech CAMERA pushes past him and lingers on her as she gradually realizes that Adam is mental.

dialogues.text: (sitting up)

dialogues.text: In 1962, when the bomb was dropped on Los Angeles, my parents were in our fallout shelter.  That's where I was born. What I'd like to do Eve, is take you down into the fallout shelter with me. We could live there with my Mom and Dad. My dad said if I found a healthy girl I should "bring her on down". And you look plenty healthy to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Adam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Eve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to go back to the hotel now.  I'll call you a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  I shouldn't be over here at this hour. He rises.  She gets up and leads him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  And I'll see you in the morning in the lobby.  Do you mind waiting outside for the taxi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.  And Eve thank you for tonight...and for the kiss. My first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was at least as good as the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think better than the ocean. I'm serious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat. Goodnight!

dialogues.text: A REFRIGERATED U-HAUL TRUCK lurches down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam struggles with the gears as Troy worries about his driving skills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn, Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! He promptly pulls over and turns off the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I took the Lord's name in vain again, didn't I?  I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  There's an Adult Bookstore back there!  I'll be right back! Adam jumps out of the truck and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without question, the strangest man I've ever met.
