dialogues.text: Adam runs up.  The bookstore looks familiar.  Adam runs to the next store. It's a bar.  He runs to the next store.  It's the Malt Shop.  Adam is thrilled.  He tries the front door and at first it does not open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soda Jerk is leading about twelve followers in prayers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give us a sign!  That's all we ask! Give us some sort of sign! The front door opens and Adam peers in.  He sees the Soda Jerk; smiles broadly at him and waves.  Then he closes the door.  The Soda Jerk grabs his heart and faints.  His followers rush to his aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Troy!  Let's get those all-beef frozen patties!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout we check with Eve first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, did you buy a movie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magazine?  A toy perhaps?  In the bookstore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrating on his driving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I wouldn't go in one of those places with a gas mask on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing in agreement)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean!  I usually wear a big hat and dark glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...Seems to. Adam would not have thought that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam springs in, Troy drags in behind him (knowing the deal). Eve is standing away from the door next to a kind looking professional woman named Dr.Aron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Eve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Adam.  This is, uh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Nina Aron, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well, thank you. I'm with the County Family Services Department. Eve tells me you've been living in a bomb shelter most of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallout shelter. There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, I'd like to introduce you to my associate -- Mr. Brown. BROWN appears from the kitchen.  He's good-sized man who dresses casually.  Adam becomes uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. He nods politely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you to come with us so we can talk some more about your experiences.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that depends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thank you very much for the invitation, but I'm quite busy today. Perhaps I could see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam....you should go with Dr. Aron. It's the best thing.  The best thing for you. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...All right, Eve.  If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Aron)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I please just go home?  I was lost, but this morning I found home and I promise not to bother any of you ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go talk first, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. The two come forward.  One opens the door and one beckons for Adam to step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye. Adam looks back at Eve, who looks away. Adam exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be hearing from me. She shuts the door. Troy sits dejectedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what was I supposed to do?! He wants me to live underground with him! That's like Silence of the Lambs, don't you think?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...I know. You did the right thing. Eve goes to the window and watches as WE SEE ADAM BREAK FROM BROWN AND RUN OFF with him chasing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! She runs out.  He follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam races down the sidewalk.  He cuts left and runs between houses.  Brown is not as fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Troy run out to Aron who is dialing her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll catch him. (then into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. This is Nina Aron.  I've got a run away and I'm going to need police assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Not the police!  Don't call them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to. If a complaint is made and the person resists obser--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't have that! They'll come with their cars and their guns and their handcuffs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, please. This man needs help and you need protection from him. That's obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I don't think so. I'm confused but you know, I don't think he'd ever hurt me. I don't think he'd hurt anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now you must let me be the judge of that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was frightened and I didn't know what to think! But you know-I believe him. I think he just wants to go home. Wherever the hell that is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all remain calm. That's the key thing. Suddenly Adam appears from the side of the house, startling everyone. He tosses his hotel key to Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key to my hotel room!  I want you to have my baseball cards! (running to the truck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And please be sure to pay my bill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young man, stop right there! Aron looks around for Mr. Brown. Adam jumps into the truck. Aron yells for him to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop, right now! Get out of that truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, you really shouldn't try to drive that truck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting the engine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Troy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, Adam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks for always being happy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. (yelling to Adam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you're...certainly welcome! Adam gets the truck in reverse and backs out of the driveway and into a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!!! That's my car, you son of a bitch!! Getting the truck in first, Adam has to go down the sidewalk a bungalow or two before he can get back onto the street.  He clips two parked cars as he does.  Brown comes running from the side of the house.  His pants are torn. ARON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell down! (to Troy and Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the license number of that truck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask them!  They're as fucked-up as the other guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all just try to remain calm. That's the key thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout I just knock the shit out of you?! Brown has to grab her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Troy arrive in her GEO to see that the two locker doors are open and much of the stuff has been carried off.  Eve drops her head in disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess he took what he could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting her head in her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God...you don't think there really is a bomb shelter, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fallout shelter. She gives him a look. TROY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is using the hip-reduction machine while Calvin reads, How to Win Friends and Influence People. The distant sound of the hatchway being open gets their attention.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?!  Dad?!  I'm home! They jump up and race into the living room, meeting Adam halfway.   The parents kiss and hug their son before noticing that he's got the Soda Jerk with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got almost everything we need! And this nice man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archbishop Melker. We met earlier. He promptly drops to his knees in supplication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and his church group have volunteered to help us bring the supplies down.  But we've got to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in trouble, son?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm being chased by a psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A psychiatrist?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My goodness! How bad is it up there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have something on your forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Troy look around.  She opens a drawer and sees how nicely folded and put away things are.  Troy notices "TV Guide" and the Gideon Bible sitting out with a page marker in it.  He opens the night table drawer and takes out the cigar box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This it? Eve nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we can't find him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve enters and looks at how tidy Adam's toiletries are; how the comb is just right in the brush; how the tooth paste (Ipanna in a '61 tube) has been squeezed from the bottom; and at how he has hung up his socks to dry.  It makes her very sad.  She picks up the toothpaste and holds it as if it were his ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Eve?  Eve? He enters with stock certificates and sees that she's very close to crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Everything's so neat. It's all just so...goddamn dear. (starting to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See these?  Found them in the box with the cards.  These are stock certificates.  IBM.  AT&T.  Polaroid. Instead of taking the certificates, she hands him the toothpaste and sits down on the bed in a funk. TROY (cont'd) (looking at the toothpaste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ipana. I think I remember that brand. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here, you should read this. "Trademark, 1961." He holds out the tube and she takes it to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, the Soda Jerk and fifteen followers hurriedly unload the truck, taking provisions into the back door of the malt shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their pal Jason is on the phone with Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Purchased in 1958 and '59?  Ten thousand shares of each?  They'd be worth millions. Hell, I don't know...millions upon millions upon millions!  How 'bout that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy is on the phone.  Eve is standing, looking at the stock certificates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jason. He slams down the phone and jumps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Millions upon millions upon millions! The cards. The stock!  The clothes! The toothpaste!  The guy was on the level!  And you blew it!  A man walks into your life who is the kindest, most polite, honest, trustworthy, incredibly rich guy you have ever met in your life!! And what do you do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have him committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! That's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was always so "nice"! How was I supposed to know that's a good thing?! "Nice" is weird! Nice is...what is "nice"? It's not cool! I'll tell you that. (beat, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I like to think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least I fell for him before I found out he was rich! That's new. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! He said today he knew where home was. What happened this morning?! Where did you go?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To get some frozen poultry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came back to the house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't stop anywhere else?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, wait a minute. We stopped at a porno store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An adult bookstore. He was very excited about seeing it. You think home is under a dirty bookstore in the Valley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. She heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trendy address. They exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Troy and Eve approach and enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pakistani looks up briefly when Eve and Troy enter. There are two male customers in the bg. Eve taps her foot on the floor hoping to hear a hollow sound.  But it is solid.  She and Troy move about the store tapping their feet and finally jumping up and down.  The Pakistani and two customers become concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pakistani)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got a basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating merchandise)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, all the really good stuff is right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a back entrance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?  Of course. He points to the rear of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soda Jerk drives the rental truck away leaving the lot empty and the door to the Malt Shop closed. Troy and Eve appear after the truck is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you put a fallout shelter under a porno shop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this stuff was here in 1962. The Valley was mostly small homes and fruit orchards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've come a long way, haven't we?  I want to go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Maybe he'll call. They turn left to get back to the avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is ringing.  Then the recorder answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Troy and Eve are out so leave a message. And if you want to leave a number don't say it fast! I hate that! Say it slow. Thank you. Beep,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Eve...this is Adam.  Look, I just wanted to thank you for everything you did for me...and I wanted to tell you that I...uh...that I wish so many good things for you. I wish so hard that all of your dreams come true. Um...I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve lets Troy drive.  She clutches the cigar box and rests her head on the seat as they pull away from the curb in front of the bookstore.  A low rider passes them on the left.  Eve sees an old hag being shoved out of the bar and a homeless man slipping into the abandoned malt shop and the cross-dressing STREET WALKER making eyes at passing cars and Adam hanging up the pay phone he just used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! She rolls down her window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam!!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM
dialogues.text: Turning when he hears Eve yell his name.

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: Running from the car.  The cigar box falls to the street and the contents scatter.  Eve could care less.  Besides, Troy is there to retrieve everything. In a series of cuts and slo-mo action the couple race into each other's arms...to the pleasure of all the lowlifes mentioned above.  Now the street looks more like Capra than Scorsese. She's surprised that she wants to kiss him so bad. He's surprised that he gets so aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen watches Calvin work on the timing device for the locks with a screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will you set it for this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's...considerably shorter than before.  I was wondering, Calvin, why set the locks at all.  I mean the radiation is gone and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep what's up there from getting down here! It's not the radiation I'm worried about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?  Dad? They turn to see Adam walking forward with Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like for you to meet Miss Eve Rustokov. Calvin knows a Russian name when he hears one. But he chooses not to pursue it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping forward, offering her hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, Mrs. Webber?  Mr. Webber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rather dumb-struck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. I've heard so many wonderful things about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, please excuse us!  We...we haven't entertained a guest in...um...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I offer you, Eve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?  Eve and I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't explain it now.  But I want you to set the locks for two months. You have more than enough of everything.  Then we'll be back to get you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, I'm asking you to trust me without understanding why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in that case...of course, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are wonderful parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait! At least stay for dinner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, please! You must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...sure...okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin mixes drinks just like he did at the party in 1962. Adam is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen races around, just like she did in 1962, getting the roast ready. Eve. watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam said I shouldn't mention the Communists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yes! Please, don't mention the Communists!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen hurries out of the kitchen to take her seat. The others are already there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve. I hope I'm not being nosey, but are you and Adam...um...dating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mrs. Webber we are. (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm also from Pasadena. Helen nearly comes unglued. Calvin is pleased, too. He raises his tea cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast! To Adam and Eve! The others also raise their cups and everyone clicks. Then they drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gagging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this sh...stuff?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot Dr. Pepper! Most people don't know how good it is heated up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, they don't, do they? They begin to eat. EVE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about grace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness! We almost forgot! (then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like your friend, Adam. They all join hands and lower their heads. Calvin leads them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought your parents were weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Eve are with a REAL ESTATE BROKER. The broker unlocks the gate of a chain-link fence and Adam and Eve step onto the property. The broker's Lexus is in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the Garden of Eden, don't you think? Adam and Eve respond but we can't hear them under Eve's narration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, that night, Adam had a choice between me and his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Eve are working with a TEAM OF ARCHITECTS AND CONTRACTORS at the site of a new home. They have plans and are discussing dimensions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's truly amazing what you can get done when you have unlimited funds. Did you know you can have whole houses built in just a matter of months. All you have to say is this..."I don't care what it costs."  And then, of course, you've got to really mean it, which no one ever does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is under construction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, Eve and Troy enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great stuff from the fifties and the sixties. Adam finds things very similar to what he grew up with. There's a lamp (or something) that's just like the lamp (or something) from the Webber living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lamp is perfect!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very faggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding that for Elton John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faggy right back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I think not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Eve embracing as Troy picks up baseball cards and the street people look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve, I've got to go back! My parents can't handle this up here. And there was no bomb, was there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See! I can't tell them that!  I can't ever let them know. It makes their life..well, frankly... a joke.  I can't let that happen.  You understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can make this work, Adam! Believe me! I'm very good at making things work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother's like that. They kiss again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Troy are showing large color drawings to the Soda Jerk.  In CU we see the Malt Shop exterior all dolled up with a big lighted sign that says "GIVE ME SHELTER." There's valet parking and the Adult Bookstore and Bar have been turned into a Souvenir Center (think Planet Hollywood).  Another drawing shows fashionable guests boarding the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took a while to convince Archbishop Milker that Adam wasn't God, and he was pretty broken up about it, too, until I showed him my plans for Los Angeles' hottest and most original night spot. Other drawings show dancing on the shelter patio and guided tours being shown various parts of the shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be a ten percent partner and still retain ownership of the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord.  And I mean the real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 1962 Cadillac leads a 1962 windowless van through automatic gates that have signs on them saying:  PRIVATE ROAD and NO TRESPASSING. Troy drives the van. Eve drives the Cadillac. Adam is her passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our idea was to bring Adam's parents up to the surface very slowly.  Make them very comfortable and then break the bad news to them that there was no nuclear holocaust. And if that doesn't kill them Adam's going to tell his father about the Internet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars pull up and Adam lets his parents out. They go bonkers when they see the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parents enter first. They are thrilled, shocked, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a demonstration, Troy removes a hot cup of coffee from the microwave.  Helen is happy to see this handy new device.  Calvin, the inventor, sticks his head into the machine to investigate its workings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam demonstrates the VCR to his parents as Troy and Eve look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put the tape in here and you get a movie -- in your own home. We see the main title to Natural Born Killers come up on the screen. Troy and Eve rush forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been turned into an office for Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Mom, I've turned it into Dad's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and I...eloped.  We're married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wonderful, dear! Wonderful!! They hug. HELEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin!  They're married!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering his hand to both)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful. We Webber guys have mighty good luck when it comes to women. Calvin points out the computer. CALVIN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's kind of a combination television- typewriter-telephone-post office type of thing. (leading Calvin out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show it to you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam and Calvin exit the house. They wear baseball gloves and start playing catch. (Calvin notes the modern construction of his glove, but does not comment on it.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great son, just great. By the way, Eve's last name. Rus-to-kov, that's not Russian, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ukrainian. Her grandparents immigrated here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I don't know how to tell you this. And I was going to wait a while, but I think...Dad,there was no bomb. A plane crashed into our backyard. I looked it up in old newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a while)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive. The Soviet Union collapsed without a shot being fired. The Cold War is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what everybody believes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. It's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Did the politburo just one day say - "We give up?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's kind of how it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Adam throws the ball, but Calvin makes no attempt to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gosh, those Commies are brilliant! You've got to hand it to 'em!  "No, we didn't drop any bombs!  Oh yes, our evil empire has collapsed!  Poor, poor us!"  I bet they've even asked the West for aid!  Right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I think they have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah!!! Those cagey rascals! Those sly dissemblers! Those, uh... (he can't think of another description, so he moves on)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've finally pulled the wool over everybody's eyes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever in your life seen a son who did more for his parents? Helen comes out with a tray of champagne cocktails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam says that this is simply how things work.  First the parents take care of the children and then the children take care of the parents. He says historically, that's how it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve and Troy are sitting by the window.  Adam and Helen come in to offer cocktails to Troy and Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever Adam gives me such obviously incorrect information, I just smile, slap him on the knee, and look out the window. Why spoil his dreams?  They're such wonderful dreams. The CAMERA wanders off of them and shoots out the glass doors. We see Calvin behind the house...measuring off the dimensions for a fallout shelter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calvin continues to measure as we pull way back and up. Perry Como sings "We'll Meet Again".
